name: QRadar
description: This app supports investigative and ingestion actions on an IBM QRadar device

authorization_token.description: Auth Token for QRadar REST API calls

artifact_max.description: Maximum number of artifacts to ingest on poll

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity. This action runs a quick query on the device to check the connection and credentials.

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
start_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is past 10 days

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
end_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is now

count.verbose: If not specified, the default is 100

offense_id.description: Id of offenses to restrict to

actions.description: Get events belonging to an offense

offense_id.description: Offense ID to get events of
offense_id.verbose: Only events belonging to this offense will be returned

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
start_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is past 10 days

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
end_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is now

count.verbose: If not specified, the default is 100

fields_filter.verbose: Use this parameter to restrict the events returned that match the filter. For e.g. destinationip='10.10.0.52' and protocolid='6'

actions.description: Get flows that make up an offense for a particular IP

ip.description: IP to get all the flows of

offense_id.verbose: Only flows belonging to this offense will be returned

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
start_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is past 10 days

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
end_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is now

count.verbose: If not specified, the default is 100

fields_filter.verbose: Use this parameter to restrict the flows returned. For e.g. protocolid='6'

offense_id.description: Offense ID to get the details of

actions.description: Execute an ariel query on the QRadar device.
actions.verbose:
Use this action to execute queries using AQL on the QRadar device. AQL is a well documented (on the IBM website) query language with quite a few inbuilt functions.
Do note that this action could have a dynamic set of values returned in the data array, since the query can specify the columns to return. This is the main reason for not listing the data paths

actions.description: Add an item to a reference set in Qradar

reference_set_name.description: Name of reference set to add to

reference_set_value.description: Value to add to the reference set

actions.description: Close an active offense, marking status=CLOSED.

closing_reason_id.verbose: 1 = Non Issue, 2 = False-Positive, Tuned, 3 = Policy Violation, 205 = Malware, 204 = Ransomware, 154 = Resolved, 54 = Subsequent Tuning Required

actions.description: Attach a note to an offense

offense_id.description: Offense ID to attach note to

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality.

container_id.description: Container IDs to limit the ingestion to.

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
start_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is past 10 days

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
end_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is now

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records to query for.

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifact records to query for.
